author: Julien
message:
For note taking, I would have recommended a digital pen (although the special paper is a bit expansive), but it looks like linux support for cursive handwriting recognition isn't all that great.

If you don't mind running proprietary software through Wine, you might want to look into Anoto or Livescribe digital pens and MyScript for handwriting recognition.

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: Oh, never heard about these products. Might have a look at them, even if having to use Wine would be quite a show stopper for me (I can live with proprietary software to a certain extent but I have been burnt too often by Wine :( )

author: skierpage
message:
Heh, 19 years ago Inkware Note Taker and other software for PenPoint let you scribble notes and search for them on the original tablet computers. BUT, they relied on background handwriting recognition getting the words right, so you were never sure if search failed because it didn't recognize your "KMessageWidget", so it made many users anxious and/or they'd spend time correcting recognition instead of taking notes; but if you're not going to attempt recognition, why get a tablet over a paper notebook? The problem of handwriting search hasn't really changed in the decades since.

http://books.google.com/boo...
